description.value: You went through a lot to get this thing. It keeps talking in your head.

gm-notes.notes:
This sword contains an evil entity from elsewhere that revels in destruction.

The sword must be Mastered by a new wielder before they may use it, and again if it put aside for any length of time. An attempt to wield the sword before this does [[/r 1d10]] damage.

Mastery requires a DC 15 PER check or [[/r 1d3]] PER damage.

A fumbled Mastery check gives control of the wielder to the sword. Should the wielder ever have 3 or fewer PER, the sword likewise gains control. It remains in control until the wielder is slain or disarmed.

Additional attempts at Mastery compel additional powers from the sword:

  • DC 20 PER or [[/r 1d5]] PER damage allows one of these benefits:
    • applies +1 to hit and damage for 1 battle
    • casts @Compendium[dcc-core-book.dcc-core-spell-journals.Magic Shield] at [[/r 1d20]] spell check
    • grants +3 to a single saving throw
  • DC 25 PER or [[/r 2d5]] PER damage allows one of these benefits:
    • applies +3 to hit and damage for 1 battle
    • casts @Compendium[dcc-core-book.dcc-core-spell-journals.Magic Missile] at [[/r 1d24]] spell check
    • turn a critical hit into a miss
  • DC 30 PER or [[/r 3d5]] PER damage allows one of these benefits:
    • applies +5 to hit and damage for 1 battle
    • casts @Compendium[dcc-core-book.dcc-core-spell-journals.Dispel Magic] at [[/r 1d30]] spell check
    • heal wielder by [[/r 1d5]] hit dice

The wielder may use the sword to heal PER damage by causing havoc and ruin. Each sentient killed by the wielder heals 1 PER point; more terrible deeds give more aid.

The sword may communicate telepathically within 20'.

Chaotic wielders cause the sword to blaze with blue-green flame adding [[/r 1d3]] damage to each hit.

The sword may hit magical, ethereal, and astral creatures.
